archimate:Folder.name: Multi-Layered Graph and Graph Visualization
archimate:Folder.documentation:
A landscape description based on two resources: 1- The article "The list of free graph visualization applications" at https://medium.com/@Elise_Deux/list-of-free-graph-visualization-applications-9c4ff5c1b3cd 2- The paper "The State of the Art in Multilayer Network Visualization" at https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/cgf.13610 3- This landscape is also related to the article "Some advanced visualisation techniques for embracing complexity of Dynamic Networks of Networks" at https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/some-advanced-visualization-technics-embracing-complexity-figay/
More than tools, what is quite important fist here is to identify the different kinds of advanved visualization technics which can contribute to elaborate semantic cartographies, with accurate interactive and dynamic visual representations allowing to capture graphs, but also different kinds of relations including composition and aggregation, and as a consequence granularity and multi-scale representations of systems of systems. The tools come in second, as software components on the shelves which implement these technics and can, or not, be used for the purpose of realizing accurate semantic cartographies in domains such as PLM or Enterprise Architecture, which are relevant for preparing and building continuous operational interoperabitlity of Enterprise Applications at an acceptable price and as a consequence the digital continuity required for end to end processes.
